AE101.name: Electrical Wiring Maintenance for Residential and Agricultural Facilities
AE101.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AE101.description: Introduction to electrical circuit maintenance, safety issues, and installation practices for residential and agricultural facilities.
AE101.restrictions: Not open to students in the Electrical Technology Major.

AE102.name: Electrical Lighting for Residential and Agricultural Facilities
AE102.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AE102.description: Introduction to electrical lighting sources, efficacies, productivity enhancement, and basic lighting design practices for residential and agricultural facilities.

AE131.name: Agricultural Water Resource Management
AE131.description: A basic knowledge, skills and tools course on water resources use and protection in agricultural production. Field trip required.
AE131.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

AE143.name: Application of Precision Agriculture Technologies
AE143.description: Practical application of the use of the tools of precision farming with a focus on widely adopted guidance, monitoring and global positioning systems. Field trip required.
AE143.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

AE151.name: Fabrication Technology
AE151.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AE151.description: Introduction to principles and practices for shop fabrication including assembly options, fabrication nomenclature, drawing interpretation, 3D printing, tool and equipment use, welding and safety practices.

AE153.name: Engine and Equipment Technology
AE153.description: Principles of gasoline and diesel engines. Fundamentals of gasoline and diesel fuel systems, ignition and cooling systems. Principles of hydraulic systems including components and hydrostatic transmissions. Maintenance and troubleshooting of engines and equipment. Offered first ten weeks of semester.

AE172.name: Electrical Wiring I
AE172.description: National Electrical Code requirements for residential, light commercial and agricultural branch circuits and services. Safe use of hand tools.
AE172.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

AE173.name: Electrical Occupations
AE173.description: Electrical wiring trade, job openings, preparation of a resume, interviewing for a job, preparing reports. Offered first ten weeks of semester.
AE173.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

AE182.name: Electrical Wiring II
AE182.description: Installation of electrical circuits for residential, light commercial and agricultural installations. Offered first ten weeks of semester.
AE182.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

AE185.name: Electrical Applications
AE185.description: Application of electrical utilization equipment. Fundamentals and application of artificial illumination sources, and lighting design practices. Types, characteristics and connection of AC and DC motors. Principle of motor controlling AC, DC, stepper and servo motors. Application of variable frequency drives for induction motors. Offered first ten weeks of semester.
AE185.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

AE192.name: Electrical Wiring III
AE192.description: Commercial agricultural and industrial wiring, planning and installation, including transformers, poly-phase systems, conductor sizing and explosion-proof wiring.
AE192.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

AE194.name: Electrical Systems Planning
AE194.description: Basic electrical calculations and wiring layout. Circuit requirements, outlet location, branch circuits and services sizing, blueprint reading and cost estimation.
AE194.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

AE290.name: Independent Study
AE290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AE290.description: Supervised individual student study in electrical technology or agricultural technology.

AE452.name: Watershed Concepts
AE452.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AE452.description: Watershed hydrology and management. The hydrologic cycle, water quality, aquatic ecosystems, and social systems. Laws and institutions for managing water resources.

AE841.name: Building and Implementing Watershed Management Plans
AE841.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AE841.description: Developing and implementing watershed management plans. Problem definition, data collection, public consultation, and program evaluation.

AE842.name: Watershed Assessments and Tools
AE842.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AE842.description: Assessing and predicting physical, chemical, biological and socioeconomic conditions within watersheds. Tools and techniques for identifying, evaluating, and prioritizing problems.

AE843.name: Legal, Financial and Institutional Frameworks in Watershed Management
AE843.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AE843.description: Watershed management laws and regulations. Resolving financial and human conflicts arising from regulation.
